text: {{Infobox settlement | official_name = Los Ríos Region | native_name = Región de Los Ríos | native_name_lang = es | settlement_type = Region of Chile | seat_type = Capital | seat = Valdivia | coordinates = | subdivision_type = Country | subdivision_name = | parts_type = Provinces | parts = Valdivia, Ranco | leader_title = Intendant | leader_name = César Asenjo | leader_party = UDI | image_skyline = Alercecosterovista.JPG | image_caption = Alerce Costero National Park | image_flag = Flag of Los Ríos, Chile.svg | flag_size = 120px | flag_alt = Flag of Los Ríos Region | image_shield = Coat of arms of Los Ríos, Chile.svg | shield_size = 75px | shield_alt = Coat of Arms of Los Ríos Region | image_map = Los Rios in Chile 2018.svg | mapsize = 250px | map_caption = Map of Los Ríos Region | area_total_km2 = 18429.5 | area_footnotes = | area_rank = 11 | elevation_min_footnotes = | elevation_max_footnotes = | elevation_max_m = 2236 | elevation_min_m = 0 | population_total = 380181 | population_as_of = 2017 census | population_footnotes = | population_rank = 11 | population_density_km2 = auto | blank_name_sec1 = HDI (2019) | blank_info_sec1 = 0.795 | website = Official website | iso_code = CL-LR | footnotes = }} The XIV Los Ríos Region (, Region of the Rivers) is one of Chile's 15 first order administrative divisions. Its capital and largest city is Valdivia. It began to operate as a region on 2007, having been created by subdividing the Los Lagos Region in southern Chile. It consists of two provinces: Valdivia and the new El Ranco province, that was part of the Valdivia province. ==Geography== The Los Ríos region has an area of . It borders the La Araucanía region to the north, Argentina to the east, the Los Lagos region to the south and the Pacific Ocean on the west. The two main rivers in the region are the Valdivia river, in the northern part of the region, and the Bueno river, in the southern part of the region. The highest mountain in the region is the Villarrica volcano () (), high, near the border with Argentina. ==Population== The Los Ríos had a population of 356,396 inhabitants (2002 census) and its population density was . The largest city in the region is its capital, Valdivia, with 127,750 inhabitants (2002 census). The other provincial capital, La Unión had 25,615 inhabitants. ==Administration== The Los Ríos region is further subdivided into two provinces: Valdivia and El Ranco.
